p:
Our study provides insights into PrEP uptake in several subpopulations, including adolescents and young adults, men, and serodifferent partners, using a population-level denominator. In our study communities
9 and across sub-Saharan Africa, adolescent girls and young women have among the highest HIV risk, yet they were less likely than women aged 25 years or older to initiate PrEP. A barrier for adolescents and young adults in our study was that these individuals were more likely to be mobile than older people. In our qualitative work, adolescents and young adults who initiated PrEP were motivated by high perceived HIV risk and beliefs that PrEP use supported pursuing life goals, but some wanted “proof”
19 of PrEP efficacy. Further mixed-methods investigation of these barriers is warranted.
